tool.name: Make FASTA non-redundant
tool.help:
**What it does**
Takes one or more input FASTA files, checks them to find any duplicate sequences (ignoring the case), and writes an output FASTA file where any duplicates appear once with combined identifier.
For example::
>1 first entry act >2 The A-Team AAaa >3 not unique... ACgt >4 CCCC >5 a duplicate acgt >6 last! GGGG
In this simple example ``ACGT`` appears twice (ignoring case) as entries ``3`` and ``6``. Entry ``3`` is renamed as ``3;6`` and entry ``4`` is omitted:
>1 first entry act >2 The A-Team AAaa >3;5 representing 2 records ACgt >4 CCCC >6 last! GGGG
This means that the representative records take the position and sequence case from the first entry with that sequence.
Notice the unique sequences are preserved as they were with any description or mixed case.
**References**
Please cite:
P.J.A. Cock, J.M. Chilton, B. Gruening, J.E. Johnson, N. Soranzo (2015). NCBI BLAST+ integrated into Galaxy. *GigaScience* 4:39 https://doi.org/10.1186/s13742-015-0080-7
This wrapper is available to install into other Galaxy Instances via the Galaxy Tool Shed at http://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/view/peterjc/make_nr
